intro: Dimorphocalyx trichocarpus, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
